abstract_summ: Everybody must deal with restrictions on freedom of movement that have shut down whole economies in an attempt to flatten the epidemic curve.• Prolonged grief disorder (PGD) cases will rise following the COVID-19 pandemic; • The pandemic shows similarities to natural disasters which increase PGD prevalence.In China 3.8% of all cases of COVID-19 were in healthcare workers, but 14.8% of those had severe or critical disease.1.The current COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in an unprecedented worldwide health crisis.• The circumstances of death during the pandemic likely increase PGD prevalence.It has become clear that the healthcare worker army that forms the front line are also at increased risk of exposure to the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes this disease.As we write at the end of March 2020, the coronavirus disease 19 (COVID-19) pandemic is posing an urgent and significant threat to global health.
title_summ: COVID-19: protecting our ENT workforce.[COVID-19 and pregnancy].Lessons learned from the COVID‐19 pandemicProlonged grief disorder following the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemicSARS-CoV-2 From the Trenches: A Perspective From New York City.COVID-19: What have we learnt, and plan for the future.
